intro: Boechera formosa, commonly known as the showy rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arctic environments. Its flowers are small and white or pale purple, arranged in clusters that bloom in early summer. The plant has a compact growth habit and is adapted to harsh, cold climates.
